alert.note: Alert for Big Stone; Traverse (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 12:04PM CST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...A SIGNIFICANT AMOUNT OF RAIN AND ICE AND SNOW IS POSSIBLE NEXT WEEK... A winter storm is forecast to move out of the Rockies Monday night and track northeast across the central and northern plains through Wednesday night. Its influence will be felt up into the northern plains, including central and northeast South Dakota, and west central Minnesota, where a mix of winter precipitation will be possible. Presently, the heaviest precipitation potential exists from early Tuesday morning through Wednesday night. By Wednesday morning, strong north winds may be spreading over into the Missouri River valley region, adding blowing and drifting snow potential to the forecast over central and north central South Dakota. Difficult travel conditions are possible between Monday night and Thursday morning from a combination of potentially significant snow accumulation, icy roads, and drifting snow. If you have travel or outdoor plans next week, be sure to check the latest forecasts and road conditions, as well as carry a winter survival kit in your vehicle.
